alert.note: Alert for Chester; Decatur; Hardin; Henderson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 10 at 12:26AM CDT until August 10 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Henderson County in west Tennessee... North central Hardin County in west Tennessee... East central Chester County in west Tennessee... Decatur County in west Tennessee... * Until 100 AM CDT. * At 1226 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Reagan, or 9 miles south of Lexington, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Lexington, Parsons, Decaturville, Sardis, Reagan, Darden, Montgomery, Scotts Hill, Enville, Haney, Hinkle, Roby, Pleasant Grove, Mount Tabor, Cabo, Middle Fork, Red Walnut, Thurman, Lick Skillet and Perryville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for west Tennessee. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for west Tennessee.
